Detailed Description

Main Qt window.

This graphical user interface offers a basic play/pause buttons for running/pausing the simulation, a table view of the global parameters, a graphical view of the cell colony with color code for the cells and the background based on the species concentration and a table view of the selected cell's state.

Dynamics of the cells are calculated with the Open Dynamics Engine (ODE) library in the GraphicsCellSceneODE colonyScene_.

void MainWindow::runSimulation (  )  [slot]

Run the simulation.

  • At the beginning of each trajectory, we initialize the colony view and integrate the ODE dynamics for equilibration of the cells.

  • Simulation step.

  • Update MainWindow (all widgets update is done here).

Play/Pause the simulation.

int MainWindow::calculateSimulationTotalProgress (  )  [private]

void MainWindow::initiateColonyView (  )  [private]

Initiate both the model and view of the colony graphics view.

  • Set lastUpdateTime_ to 0.

  • Initiate the scene.

  • Create the cell graphics objects and add them to the scene.

  • Set the openGLViewer_.

  • Link the view to the scene and show it.

void MainWindow::updateColonyView (  )  [private]

Update the colony view.

  • Add and remove cells to the scene.

  • Update cells length and color based on the volume and species concentration of simulator's cells.

  • Update scene background color base on the species concentration of the simulator's milieu.

  • Compute the ODE simulation step (cells spatial dynamics).

  • Update the OpenGLViewer.

  • Update lastUpdateTime_.

void MainWindow::addAndRemoveCellsColonyView (  )  [private]

Get the list of duplicating/deleting events from the simulator and duplicate/delete cells in the colonyScene_.

Remark: the order of duplication/deleting events matches the list given by the simulator. It could be important because these events are changing the cells indices...

  • Get the list of cell division/death events from the simulator.

  • Apply events to the colonyScene_ by calling the GraphicsCellSceneODE::duplicateCell() and GraphicsCellSceneODE::deleteOneCell() methods.

void MainWindow::createCellGroupGraphics ( GraphicsCellScene *  colonyScene  )  [private]

Create the cell graphics objects based on the Simulator data and add them to the colony scene.

  • Get position, angle and volume of the cells from the Simulator.

  • Create and add cells to the colony scene.

Get the array of global parameters from the simulator.

void MainWindow::initiateGlobalParameterTable (  )  [private]

Initiate the global parameter table.

Both the model globalParameterModel_ and the view Ui::MainWindow::globalParameterTableView are initialized.

  • Create the model with the data.

void MainWindow::updateGlobalParameterTable (  )  [private]

Update the global parameter table.

Calls getGlobalParameterArray() and updates the globalParameterModel_.

Array< QString, 2 > MainWindow::getCellStateArray ( int  cellIndex  )  [private]

Get the cell state array from the simulator.

Parameters:
cellIndex The index of the cell, from 0 to nCells-1, the index -1 stays for the milieu.

  • Declare data for the model: a QString table.

  • Get species names, number of molecules and concentrations from the simulator.

  • The first line of the table contains the cell number.

  • Fill in the values of the QString array with the data from the simulator.

void MainWindow::initiateCellStateTable ( int  cellIndex  )  [private]

Initiate and create the cell state table model for the cell state table view.

The model contains the data and the view manages how the data is shown on screen.

Parameters:
cellIndex The index of the cell, from 0 to nCells-1, the index -1 stays for the milieu.

void MainWindow::updateCellStateTable (  )  [private]

Update the cell state table.

Calls getCellStateArray() and updates the cell state model.

Member Data Documentation

Ui::MainWindow* MainWindow::ui [private]

The MainWindow class generated by the Qt Designer.

Simulator* MainWindow::simulator_ [private]

A pointer to the Simulator object.

The graphical interface has to communicate with the Simulator class in order to perform simulation steps, get cell's concentrations and volume, send cell positions and angle.

bool MainWindow::simulationEnd_ [private]

bool MainWindow::simulationPaused_ [private]

double MainWindow::lastUpdateTime_ [private]

double MainWindow::cellLength0_ [private]

double MainWindow::cellHeight0_ [private]

GraphicsCellSceneODE MainWindow::colonyScene_ [private]

The colony graphics scene where cells are drawn.

In this graphics scene, cells are drawn as elongated cylinders. At each simulation step, we set the color of the cells according to the cell's color code as well as the color of the background according to the milieu's color code. The color of the cells and the background follow a color gradient based on the concentration of the selected species and the selected maximum value. Movement of the cells is computed through the Open Dynamics Engine, inherited by the GraphicsCellSceneODE class.

OpenGLViewer* MainWindow::openGLViewer_ [private]

A small openGL viewer that offers a view of the ODE cell objects.

double MainWindow::sceneSize_ [private]

Size of the colony scene (width and height are the same).

double MainWindow::colonySize_ [private]

Size of the colony coordinate system: Simulator coordinates are transformed from [0,1] to [-colonySize_/2,colonySize/2].

The global parameters model.

The cell state model.

See also:
Ui::MainWindow::cellStateTableView

int MainWindow::cellStateIndex_ [private]

The index of the cell which state is displayed in the Ui::MainWindow::cellStateTableView.

An index of -1 stays for the milieu.

QStringListModel MainWindow::speciesNameListModel_ [private]

The list model for the species names of the cells, the selected species concentration is used for the color code of the cells.

See also:
speciesCellColorIndex_

speciesCellColorMaxValue_

int MainWindow::speciesCellColorIndex_ [private]

The index of the species (in the species name list speciesNameListModel_) that is used for the color code of the cells.

double MainWindow::speciesCellColorMaxValue_ [private]

Set the maximum value for the scale of species concentration for the color code of the cells.

The color code is a color gradient based on concentration scale 0 to speciesCellColorMaxValue_.

QGraphicsScene MainWindow::speciesColorCodeScene_ [private]

The graphics scene of the color code gradient for the cells, associated to the Ui::MainWindow::colorCodeGraphicsView.

This is a small rectangle with the color code gradient inside, for better visualization of the color code scale.
